Entities.Name: COVID-19
Entities.Definition: The virus causing the global pandemic, detected via radiological text reports integrating entity recognition.
Entities.Sample Data: Sentences mentioning 'COVID-19' as the causative agent in pneumonia or lung infection.

Entities.Name: Pneumonia
Entities.Definition: A common symptom of COVID-19, identified as lung infection in CT scans.
Entities.Sample Data: Example sentences from radiological reports could describe 'bilateral bronchopneumonia' as observed in patient scans.

Entities.Name: Ground-Glass Opacities
Entities.Definition: Radiological feature seen in lung CT scans, commonly associated with COVID-19 infections.
Entities.Sample Data: Radiology reports noting 'ground-glass opacities' which are diffuse, indicating possible viral infection.

Entities.Name: SNOMED-CT
Entities.Definition: A systematically organized computer processable collection of medical terms providing codes, terms, synonyms and definitions used in clinical documentation and reporting.
Entities.Sample Data: Used in the document to refer to the taxonomy and coding in radiology reports.

Dataset.Name: Radiological reports
Dataset.Details: 295 radiological reports from chest CT studies suspicious of COVID-19, used to train and evaluate the classification system.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Guidelines for using machine learning and natural language processing to automatically extract COVID-19 related disorders from text. The guidelines discuss the use of SNOMED-CT and other biomedical ontologies.
Annotation Guidelines.Link: Direct links or references to the guidelines are not provided in the document.
